title: PDCA ADK loop hardening
description:
Goal:
- Eliminate duplicate PDCA step execution and harden ADK PDCA runtime error handling.

Acceptance:
- [ ] LoopAgent executes only the orchestrator each iteration (no duplicated step runs).
- [ ] Step persistence and artifact writes fail fast on errors; no silent state divergence.
- [ ] Check/Act response validation is enforced for ok responses.
- [ ] Session task state loading is panic-safe.
- [ ] internal/agent parse failures cannot pass silently (or path is explicitly deprecated and removed).

Notes/Constraints:
- Keep workflow contract as `plan -> do -> check -> act`.
- Follow AGENTS.md quality gates: `go test ./...` and `go tool golangci-lint run`.

title: Named agent registry with PDCA/feature references
description:
Goal:
- Support arbitrary named agents per profile, with PDCA steps referencing agents by name, and feature-specific references to agents.
- Preserve profile-based configuration and backward compatibility with existing role-keyed configs.

Acceptance:
- [ ] A profile can define any number of named agents under a registry.
- [ ] PDCA step roles (plan/do/check/act) resolve runner agents via explicit name references.
- [ ] Feature sections can reference named agents without forcing those agents to be PDCA runners.
- [ ] Existing configs that map role names directly to agent configs continue to work (compat mode) or fail with clear migration errors.
- [ ] Config resolution and validation are covered by tests.

Notes/Constraints:
- Keep fixed PDCA workflow order unchanged (`plan -> do -> check -> act`).
- Keep `profile` selection behavior and preserve current CLI UX.
- Prefer additive schema evolution and clear migration path.
close_reason: Completed with strict YAML + named-agent references (no compat path)
